BIOL CS 5.title: Group Studies
BIOL CS 5.description: Student-directed discussion and study in a variety of subjects within Biology.

BIOL CS 10.title: Biology Colloquium
BIOL CS 10.comments: May be taken as often as once each quarter.
BIOL CS 10.description: Students receiving credit will present talks in their field on material arranged in consultation with the instructor. Credit assigned by the instructor will reflect the extent and quality of participation.

BIOL CS 12.title: CCS Introductory Biology I
BIOL CS 12.comments:
Designed for majors. Quarters usually offered: Fall. This variable unit course is normally taken for 1 unit.
Repeat Comments: Course may not be repeated for credit.
BIOL CS 12.description: This course is supplementary to MCDB 1A.  It is intended for and open only to CCS students enrolled in MCDB 1A.  Students will attend MCDB 1A lectures and also meet for more in-depth consideration and analysis of the lecture materials and their broader implications.

BIOL CS 20.title: CCS Introductory Biology II - Evolution and Diversity
BIOL CS 20.comments: Designed for majors. Quarters usually offered: Winter. This variable unit course is normally taken for 5 units.
BIOL CS 20.description: Lecture, field and laboratory activities explore the evolutionary origin and diversification of life in a phylogenetic context, from bacteria and archaea to plants, fungi and animals.
BIOL CS 20.recommended_prep: This course is intended for first year CCS Biology majors who have completed MCDB 1A and MCDB 1AL.

BIOL CS 25.title: Walking Biology
BIOL CS 25.comments: Open to non-majors. Quarters usually offered: Spring. This variable unit course is normally taken for 4 units.
BIOL CS 25.description: Field course introducing students to the ecological communities in Santa Barbara County, including oak woodlands, chaparral, coastal dune, salt marsh, sandy beach, rocky inter-tidal, and stream.

BIOL CS 30.title: CCS Introductory Biology III - Ecology and Physiology
BIOL CS 30.comments: Designed for majors. Quarters usually offered: Spring. This variable unit course is normally taken for 5 units.
BIOL CS 30.description: An integrative approach introduces students to fundamental concepts of population and community ecology, and to plant and animal physiology.  Field and laboratory activities illustrate basic principles in ecology and physiology as they influence the distribution and abundance or organisms.
BIOL CS 30.recommended_prep: This course is intended for first year CCS Biology majors who have completed MCDB 1A, MCDB 1AL, and either Biology CS 20, or concurrent enrollment in EEMB 3.

BIOL CS 101.title: Models and Experiments
BIOL CS 101.comments: May be taken as often as once each quarter.
BIOL CS 101.description: Interplay between models and experimentation in the development of an understanding of the principles of biology.

BIOL CS 103.title: Reading Project
BIOL CS 103.comments: May be taken as often as once each quarter.
BIOL CS 103.description: Set up by the student in consultation with the instructor, and concluding with the student's report of progress.

BIOL CS 105.title: Research Presentation
BIOL CS 105.comments: Open to non-majors. Quarters usually offered: Fall. This variable unit course is normally taken for 2 units.
BIOL CS 105.description: Introduction to the major methods of presenting research results:  formal talks, research papers and posters.  Students will practice presenting their research in different formats for different audiences.
BIOL CS 105.recommended_prep: Intended for students who have completed or are currently involved in research projects.  Designed for Biology majors but open to students from other majors.

BIOL CS 109.title: Advanced Independent Research
BIOL CS 109.description: Independent research on an original subject under faculty supervision carried out in a biology faculty research group. These advanced projects will attempt reseach of publishable quality; generally resulting in the preparation of a written report or manuscript for publication.

BIOL CS 199.title: Independent Studies
BIOL CS 199.comments: May be repeated for credit. Creative Studies students may enroll in a maximum of 24 units of Independent Studies courses per year, with a maximum of 45 units counted toward graduation.
BIOL CS 199.description: Serious independent study in biology with consenting faculty member.
